Run Climate Window Analysis (based on climwin)

Source: R/runing_climwin.R
runing_climwin.Rd

This function performs a climate window analysis using the climwin package to identify the optimal climate window (i.e., period of influence) that best explains variations in a biological response variable, typically seed production. The analysis uses a sliding window approach to correlate climate variables with biological observations.

runing_climwin(
  ...,
  climate_data,
  bio_data,
  site.name,
  range = c(600, 0),
  cinterval = "day",
  refday = c(1, 11),
  optionwindows = "absolute",
  climate_var = "TMEAN",
  stat.aggregate = "mean",
  formulanull = stats::formula("log.seed ~ 1"),
  fun = "lin",
  cmissing = "method2",
  give.clean = TRUE
)

Arguments

climate_data

A data frame or tibble containing climate data. Must include a date column and a column matching the name provided in climate_var (e.g., "TMEAN").

bio_data

A data frame or tibble containing biological data, including a Date2 column (date of biological observation) and the response variable used in formulanull.

site.name

A character string used to label the output (e.g., the name or ID of the site being analyzed).

range

A numeric vector of length two indicating the maximum and minimum time before the reference date (in days) over which to search for climate windows. Default is c(600, 0).

cinterval

The interval over which to aggregate the climate variable. Options include "day", "week", etc. Default is "day".

refday

Either a numeric DOY (e.g., 305 for November 1) or a vector of day and month (e.g., c(1, 11) for November 1). This sets the reference date for absolute windows.

optionwindows

One of "absolute" or "relative". "absolute" windows are fixed in time (e.g., fixed season), while "relative" windows move with the biological event. Default is "absolute".

climate_var

Name of the column in climate_data containing the climate variable of interest (e.g., "TMEAN"). Default is "TMEAN".

stat.aggregate

Aggregation function to apply within the window. One of "mean", "sum", "min", or "max". Default is "mean".

formulanull

A formula specifying the null model (e.g., log.seed ~ 1). Must match a column in bio_data. Default is log.seed ~ 1.

fun

Functional form used to test the climate effect. Common values are "lin" (linear), "quad" (quadratic), etc. Default is "lin".

cmissing

Method for handling missing climate data. See climwin::slidingwin() documentation. Default is "method2".

give.clean

Logical. If TRUE, returns a cleaned summary of results including slope, intercept, R², AIC, and window bounds. If FALSE, returns the full output from climwin::slidingwin(). Default is TRUE.

Value

A data frame containing the best-fit window statistics:

  • sitenewname: Site label from bio_data

  • climate.file: Site name provided to site.name

  • window.open, window.close: Days before the reference date indicating the climate window

  • r2, AIC: Performance metrics for the best-fit model

  • slope.estimate, intercept.estimate: Coefficient summaries from the best-fit model

  • sigma: Model residual standard deviation

Details

This function is a wrapper around climwin::slidingwin() with additional input checks and a standardized output format. It is intended for automated analysis across multiple sites or datasets. The refday input supports both numeric DOY and day-month vector formats.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- runing_climwin_site(
  climate_data = my_climate,
  bio_data = my_seeds,
  site.name = "site1"
)
} # }
